quiz.title: Chemistry Grade 10: Unit 11 Quiz 6
quiz.subtitle: 11.6: Review: Atomic Structure and Bonding
quiz.subject: Chemistry
quiz.topic: Comprehensive review of atomic theory and chemical bonding

questions.question: Which subatomic particles are located in the nucleus and determine the mass number of an atom?
questions.explanation: The nucleus contains protons and neutrons, which provide nearly all of an atom's mass, while electrons orbit the exterior.

questions.question: An isotope of an element is defined by having the same number of protons but a different number of which particle?
questions.explanation: Isotopes are variants of the same element that differ in mass due to a different count of neutrons in the nucleus.

questions.question: What is the maximum number of electrons that can occupy the second energy level (n = 2)?
questions.explanation: The second energy level consists of one s-orbital and three p-orbitals, holding a combined maximum of 8 electrons.

questions.question: Which type of chemical bond involves the complete transfer of electrons from a metal to a nonmetal?
questions.explanation: Ionic bonds form through the electrostatic attraction between ions created when one atom gives up electrons to another.

questions.question: What does a Lewis dot structure primarily represent about an atom of a representative element?
options: The total count of all electrons
The number of neutrons in the core
The density of the electron cloud
questions.explanation: Lewis structures use dots to show only the valence electrons, which are the electrons involved in chemical bonding.

questions.question: Which rule states that atoms tend to gain, lose, or share electrons to achieve a full outer shell of eight?
questions.explanation: The octet rule describes the tendency of atoms to prefer having eight electrons in their valence shell for stability.

questions.question: In a polar covalent bond, how are the electrons distributed between the two bonded atoms?
options: They are shared unequally due to differences in electronegativity
They are shared perfectly equally between the two identical nuclei
They are transferred entirely from the cation to the large anion
They are delocalized and move freely throughout the metal lattice
questions.explanation: Polar covalent bonds occur when one atom attracts the shared electrons more strongly than the other atom.

questions.question: Which group of elements on the periodic table is characterized by having a naturally full valence shell?
questions.explanation: Noble gases (Group 18) have full valence shells, making them chemically stable and generally unreactive.

questions.question: What is the charge of an ion that has 12 protons and 10 electrons?
questions.explanation: With two more positive protons than negative electrons, the ion has a net positive charge of +2 (Magnesium ion).

questions.question: Which property measures an atom's ability to attract shared electrons in a chemical bond?
questions.explanation: Electronegativity is the chemical property that describes the tendency of an atom to attract a bonding pair of electrons.
